subject: Sleep
title: Hypervigilance and Sleep
description: A 60-second lesson on Hypervigilance and Sleep.

hook.text: A trauma survivor can't sleep without checking the locks three times, scanning every shadow, and facing the door.

buildup.text: PTSD rewires the brain's threat detection system to stay permanently on alert, even in safe environments.

discovery.text: Hypervigilance keeps the sympathetic nervous system activated, preventing the body from entering sleep mode.

twist.text: Even when sleep occurs, it's lighter and more fragmented. The brain maintains partial awareness for threats.

climax.text: Creating a structured safe sleep environment and using grounding techniques can gradually reduce threat monitoring.

punchline.text: PTSD turns your bedroom into a place your brain refuses to trust.

quiz.question: How does hypervigilance affect sleep in PTSD?
options: It has no effect on sleep
It keeps the sympathetic nervous system active, preventing deep sleep
